ref: 8357 pr̥thivīˊ -- , pr̥thvīˊ -- f. ʻ the earth ʼ RV. [The ʻ laryngeal ʼ explanation of pr̥thivīˊ -- (accepted EWA ii 334) is most doubtful: Av. yezivī, which cannot be shown to have schwa, is poss., with Humbach Die Gathas ii 94, metr. dissyllabic like RV. yahvīˊ -- . Apart from Pk. pahivī<-> which agrees with Sk., MIA. and NIA. show only -- u<-> and -- a -- . Poss. there was an alternation *pr̥thuvī ~ *pr̥thavyāḥ like vásvī ~ vasavyàm, while pr̥thivīˊ -- is a phonet. conditioned variant like púruṣa -- beside *pūrṣa -- , *puriṣa -- and prátūrti -- beside tīrṇá -- (J. C. W.). -- √prath]
Pa. pathavī -- , puth˚, puthuvī -- , paṭhavī -- f. ʻ the earth ʼ,

lang: Gāndhārī or Northwest Prakrit (as recorded in the Dharmapada ed. J. Brough, Oxford 1962)
